Tourist sights in Capricornia worthy of the tourist's attention:

value: - town on the Fitzroy River and the commercial centre of the region. Noted for its historic buildings dating from the late-19th century. Dreamtime Cultural Centre worth a visit - provides displays relating to region's Aboriginal past. Rockhampton promotes itself as the "beef capital of Australia", with many pubs and restaurants serving large steaks.
& Around - on the coast north-east of Rockhampton. Popular beach resort - beaches at (north to south): Farnborough, Yeppoon Town, Lammermoor, Kemp Beach, Mulambin, Kinka Beach and
to the north - potteries and state parks in region.
- old gold mining town located in hills south-west of Rockhampton. Museum and railway tours.
& Around - industrial port situated on the shores of Port Curtis. Industry tours. Tondoon Botanic Gardens south of town. On the coast to the south of Gladstone are the tourist resorts of
- Agnes Water contains the most northerly surfing beach on Australia's east coast.
. Gem-fossicking at nearby Rubyvale and Sapphire.
